title: Prices allocate resources in capitalist economy

content.question: Which of the following is true in a capitalist economy?

choices.label: The factors of production are collectively owned.
The factors of production are distributed according to needs.
The prices of goods and services are usually determined by the government.
The prices of goods and services are set so that an equitable distribution of private property is achieved.
Prices serve as incentives for factors of production to move to the markets where they are most valued.

content.answer: Prices serve as incentives for factors of production to move to the markets where they are most valued.
